channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

item.title: Your Zip Code Might Be As Important To Health As Your Genetic Code
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Health care forms increasingly ask about more than just medical history. That's because doctors are beginning to understand that a patient's stress, and how and where they live, influence health, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Health care forms increasingly ask about more than just medical history. That's because doctors are beginning to understand that a patient's stress, and how and where they live, influence health, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/04/539757759/your-zip-code-can-be-as-important-to-health-as-your-genetic-code

item.title: South Texas Fights Tuberculosis One Blood Test At A Time
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Texas has one of the highest rates of TB among U.S. states. A sweeping effort is underway, largely funded by Medicaid, to diagnose and treat people who don't know they harbor the lung infection.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Texas has one of the highest rates of TB among U.S. states. A sweeping effort is underway, largely funded by Medicaid, to diagnose and treat people who don't know they harbor the lung infection. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/04/539800393/south-texas-fights-tuberculosis-one-blood-test-at-a-time

item.title: Technology Gets Under The Skin
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Last week, a Wisconsin company offered its employees the option to have a chip inserted into their bodies in an effort to help them navigate the workplace. Alva Noë asks: What's the big deal?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Last week, a Wisconsin company offered its employees the option to have a chip inserted into their bodies in an effort to help them navigate the workplace. Alva Noë asks: What's the big deal? http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/04/541106998/technology-gets-under-the-skin

item.title: Scientists Aim For Better, Cheaper Tests For Alzheimer's
item.description: August 4, 2017 - The goal is to find accurate, painless tests that can help doctors diagnose Alzheimer's early and track the progression of the illness and any response to treatment. A few tests seem promising.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - The goal is to find accurate, painless tests that can help doctors diagnose Alzheimer's early and track the progression of the illness and any response to treatment. A few tests seem promising. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/04/541393576/scientists-aim-for-better-cheaper-tests-for-alzheimers

item.title: The Archaeologist Who Hunts For Stolen Art
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Christos Tsirogiannis, a forensic archaeologist, explains to Ailsa Chang how he persuaded U.S. authorities to seize an ancient Italian vase from the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Christos Tsirogiannis, a forensic archaeologist, explains to Ailsa Chang how he persuaded U.S. authorities to seize an ancient Italian vase from the Metropolitan Museum of Art. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/04/541538834/the-archaeologist-who-hunts-for-stolen-art

item.title: Uncovering A 'Little Pompeii' In France
item.description: August 4, 2017 - Archaeologists in France have discovered the well-preserved ruins of a Roman town, whose inhabitants appear to have fled to avoid a fire — leaving their belongings and household objects behind.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - Archaeologists in France have discovered the well-preserved ruins of a Roman town, whose inhabitants appear to have fled to avoid a fire — leaving their belongings and household objects behind. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/04/541538827/uncovering-a-little-pompeii-in-france

item.title: Saving Vultures With Nepal's 'Vulture Restaurant'
item.description: August 4, 2017 - A unique conservation attempt is underway in Nepal to save vultures that have nearly been decimated through much of South Asia over the past few decades.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 4, 2017 - A unique conservation attempt is underway in Nepal to save vultures that have nearly been decimated through much of South Asia over the past few decades. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/04/541538778/saving-vultures-with-nepals-vulture-restaurant

item.title: Vermont Medical School Says Goodbye To Lectures
item.description: August 3, 2017 - The University of Vermont's Larner College of Medicine is planning to phase out lectures by 2019. The dean behind the effort says lectures aren't good at engaging learners.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - The University of Vermont's Larner College of Medicine is planning to phase out lectures by 2019. The dean behind the effort says lectures aren't good at engaging learners. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/03/541411275/vermont-medical-school-says-goodbye-to-lectures

item.title: White House Reverses Effort To Delay Obama Ozone Regulations
item.description: August 3, 2017 - The Trump administration has reversed its effort to delay implementation of an Environmental Protection Agency regulation lowering acceptable ozone emissions, a major component of smog. The reversal comes after 16 states filed a lawsuit saying the delay was unlawful.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - The Trump administration has reversed its effort to delay implementation of an Environmental Protection Agency regulation lowering acceptable ozone emissions, a major component of smog. The reversal comes after 16 states filed a lawsuit saying the delay was unlawful. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/03/541432494/white-house-reverses-effort-to-delay-obama-ozone-regulations

item.title: Artificial Light Deters Nocturnal Pollinators, Study Suggests
item.description: August 3, 2017 - Scientists in Switzerland used mobile streetlamps to light up patches of cabbage thistle. They found that nocturnal pollinators, such as beetles and flies, mostly stayed away.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - Scientists in Switzerland used mobile streetlamps to light up patches of cabbage thistle. They found that nocturnal pollinators, such as beetles and flies, mostly stayed away. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/03/541383664/study-suggests-artificial-light-deters-nocturnal-pollinators

item.title: Do You Have What It Takes To Be NASA's Next Planetary Protection Officer?
item.description: August 3, 2017 - The job posting has elicited headlines about how the space agency is seeking a person to defend Earth from aliens. But it's really more about microorganisms than little green men.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - The job posting has elicited headlines about how the space agency is seeking a person to defend Earth from aliens. But it's really more about microorganisms than little green men. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/03/541352728/do-you-have-what-it-takes-to-be-nasa-s-next-planetary-protection-officer

item.title: Animal Images In Prehistoric Rock Art: Looking Beyond Europe
item.description: August 3, 2017 - Animals are depicted in rock art in more than 100 countries, not just in the famous "painted caves" of Europe. Barbara J. King talks to an archaeologist with a global view of human meaning-making.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - Animals are depicted in rock art in more than 100 countries, not just in the famous "painted caves" of Europe. Barbara J. King talks to an archaeologist with a global view of human meaning-making. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/03/540805776/animal-images-in-prehistoric-rock-art-looking-beyond-europe

item.title: The Gulf Of Mexico's Dead Zone Is The Biggest Ever Seen
item.description: August 3, 2017 - A record-setting "dead zone," where water doesn't have enough oxygen for fish to survive, has appeared this summer. One major cause is pollution from farms.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - A record-setting "dead zone," where water doesn't have enough oxygen for fish to survive, has appeared this summer. One major cause is pollution from farms. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/03/541222717/the-gulf-of-mexicos-dead-zone-is-the-biggest-ever-seen

item.title: Earthquake Shakes Central Oklahoma, One Of 7 In 28 Hours
item.description: August 3, 2017 - An earthquake of preliminary magnitude 4.2 hit Wednesday night. Earthquakes used to be rare in Oklahoma. Scientists say they're linked to the disposal of wastewater from fracking.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 3, 2017 - An earthquake of preliminary magnitude 4.2 hit Wednesday night. Earthquakes used to be rare in Oklahoma. Scientists say they're linked to the disposal of wastewater from fracking. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/03/541298754/earthquake-shakes-central-oklahoma-one-of-7-in-28-hours

item.title: Environmental Groups Challenge EPA In Court Over Ozone Rule
item.description: August 2, 2017 - The Trump administration seeks to roll back and delay dozens of regulations across government, including one to lower smog-creating ozone. Environmental groups are challenging the EPA in court.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 2, 2017 - The Trump administration seeks to roll back and delay dozens of regulations across government, including one to lower smog-creating ozone. Environmental groups are challenging the EPA in court. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/02/541197543/environmental-groups-challenge-epa-in-court-over-ozone-rule
